title: Benefit sanction warning period to be introduced, Iain Duncan Smith announces
text: The benefit sanctions system will be made less aggressive in response to criticism of it from a parliamentary committee, Iain Duncan Smith has announced. The Work and Pensions Secretary said people subjected to sanctions would from now on initially be given a “yellow card” or warning when the sanction –a benefit deduction – was triggered. Claimants would then be given a 14 day period to provide evidence of why a sanction was not deserved before the monetary penalty was applied. Under current rules, such a sanction would be applied immediately. The Work and Pensions Secretary said the new approach would be introduced on a trial basis. Read more
